description: From Middle English preamble, from Old French preambule (French préambule), from Medieval Latin praeambulum, from praeambulō (“I walk before”).

entries.meaning: A short preliminary statement or remark, especially an explanatory introduction to a formal document or statute.
examples: Synonyms: foreword, preface, prologue; see also Thesaurus:foreword
Antonyms: afterword, conclusion, epilogue, last word, postamble; see also Thesaurus:afterword

verbs.description: preamble (third-person singular simple present preambles, present participle preambling, simple past and past participle preambled)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To speak or write a preamble; to provide a preliminary statement or set of remarks.
